classificationResult.measures

Interface MeasureIF

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AccuracyMeasure, F1Measure, Precision, Recall

    public interface MeasureIF
    An interface representing a measure used for evaluating the classification result

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean dependsOnClass()
      Whether the measure calculation is dependent on the class.
      java.lang.String getClassName()
      Returns the class that the measure is calculated for
      double getMeasure(ClassificationResult result)
      Returns the value of the measure
      java.lang.String getName()
      Returns the name of the algorithm that implements the measure calculation
      void setClassName(java.lang.String name)
      If dependsOnClass(), set the class for measure evaluation

    • Method Detail

      • getMeasure

        double getMeasure(ClassificationResult result)
        Returns the value of the measure
        Parameters:
        result - the result of applying a trained classifier to the supplied test set
        Returns:
        measure value

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the name of the algorithm that implements the measure calculation
        Returns:
        measure name

      • dependsOnClass

        boolean dependsOnClass()
        Whether the measure calculation is dependent on the class. For example, precision measure can be calculated for the positive class, negative class or as the average of those two values
        Returns:
        whether the class should be specified in order to calculate the measure

      • setClassName

        void setClassName(java.lang.String name)
        If dependsOnClass(), set the class for measure evaluation
        Parameters:
        name - name of the class to evaluate the measure for

      • getClassName

        java.lang.String getClassName()
        Returns the class that the measure is calculated for
        Returns:
        name of the class
